post.description:
Upload an COMBINE/OMEX archive file along with a description of the simulator to use to execute the archive.       The simulation will be excecuted and the status of the simulation run object will be updated.       
The simulation can be uploaded as a COMBINE/OMEX archive by using the multipart/form-data accept header.      Alternatively, use the application/json accept header to provide a URL to an external COMBINE/OMEX archive

400.description: The simulation run request does not adhere to the expected schema.      Please see https://api.biosimulations.org for more information.

401.description: Unauthorized

413.description: The submitted COMBINE/OMEX archive file is too large.     Uploaded archives must be less than 64 MB.

415.description: The submitted mediatype is unsupported. The mediatype must be `application/json` or `multipart/form-data`.

500.description: An error occurred in retrieving the simulator/version

get.summary: Validate a simulation run

info.title: BioSimulations API
info.description: The BioSimulations API is a RESTful API for interacting with the BioSimulations web service and database.      It provides endpoints for submitting simulation projects to be executed on the BioSimulations backend, as well as      endpoints for retrieving the associated metadata, files, logs, results, and specifications of these projects.      It it also used for the publishing, sharing and retrieving projects from the BioSimulations database

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: Operations for publishing simulation runs and modifying, getting, and deleting published projects.

tags.name: Simulations
tags.description: Operations for submitting a simulation run, checking the status of a run, modifying the details of a run, and deleting a run.

tags.name: Files
tags.description: Operations for creating and retrieving metadata about the files in a simulation run

tags.name: Specifications
tags.description: Operations for creating and retrieving simulation experiments (specifications of SED-ML files in COMBINE/OMEX archives) of simulation runs

tags.name: Results
tags.description: Operations for viewing and retrieving the results of a simulation run.

tags.name: Logs
tags.description: Operations for submitting and retrieving a log of the execution of a simulation run.

tags.name: Metadata
tags.description: Operations for creating and retrieving the metadata associated with a simulation run

tags.name: Downloads
tags.description: Operations for downloading the files and results of a simulation run.

tags.name: Ontologies
tags.description: Operations for getting a list of the supported ontologies, getting entire ontologies, and getting individual terms.

tags.name: Health
tags.description: Operations for checking the status of this API.

tags.name: Internal
tags.description: Operations for the management of BioSimulations by the BioSimulations Team.

tags.name: Authentication testing
tags.description: Operations for checking authentication and permissions to this API.

scopes.write:SimulationRuns: Modify simulation runs, including their status
scopes.externallyValidate:SimulationRuns: Externally validate simulation runs. Grants the ability to include requests to publish simulation runs with their creation.
scopes.read:Email: Read contact email addresses for resources
scopes.read:Files: Get information about files of simulation runs
scopes.write:Files: Write and modify files for simulation runs
scopes.read:Specifications: Get information about simulation experiments of simulation runs
scopes.write:Specifications: Write and modify simulation experiments for simulation runs
scopes.delete:Specifications: Delete simulation experiments for simulation runs
scopes.read:Results: Get the results of simulation runs
scopes.write:Results: Modify the results of simulation runs
scopes.delete:Results: Delete the results of simulation runs
scopes.read:Logs: Get the logs of simulation runs
scopes.write:Logs: Modify the logs of simulation runs
scopes.delete:Logs: Delete the logs of simulation runs
scopes.read:Metadata: Get the metadata for simulation runs
scopes.write:Metadata: Modify the metadata for simulation runs
scopes.delete:Metadata: Delete the metadata for simulation runs

organizations.description: Organizations that the account is a member of

title.example: RunBioSimulations: an extensible web application that simulates a wide range of computational modeling frameworks, algorithms, and formats

abstract.description: A short summary of the resource
abstract.example: This application provides a web-based platform for the simulation of computational modeling frameworks, algorithms, and formats.

keywords.description: Keywords likely to be used in search queries

description.description: A detailed description of the resource
description.example: Comprehensive, predictive computational models have significant potential for science, bioengineering, and medicine. One promising way to achieve more predictive models is to combine submodels of multiple subsystems. To capture the multiple scales of biology, these submodels will likely require multiple modeling frameworks and simulation algorithms. Several community resources are already available for working with many of these frameworks and algorithms. However, the variety and sheer number of these resources make it challenging to find and use appropriate tools for each model, especially for novice modelers and experimentalists. To make these resources easier to use, we developed runBioSimulations (https://run.biosimulations.org), a single web application for executing a broad range of models. runBioSimulations leverages community resources, including BioSimulators, a new open registry of simulation tools. These resources currently enable runBioSimulations to execute nine frameworks and 44 algorithms, and they make runBioSimulations extensible to additional frameworks and algorithms. runBioSimulations also provides features for sharing simulations and interactively visualizing their results. We anticipate that runBioSimulations will foster reproducibility, stimulate collaboration, and ultimately facilitate the creation of more predictive models.

taxa.description: The biological entity represented by the model element

encodes.description: Other biology (e.g., cell type, organ) captured by a modeling project or component of a project

sources.description: The source code or definition of the modeling project or component of a project

successors.description: Other modeling projects that were based on this project or component of a project

references.description: References for a modeling project or component of a project

example.label: D Nadeau, C Marchand. Change in the kinetics of sulphacetamide tissue distribution in Walker tumor-bearing rats. Drug Metab Dispos 3(6): 565-76 (1975).

To capture the multiple scales of biology, these submodels will likely require multiple modeling frameworks and simulation algorithms. Several community resources are already available for working with many of these frameworks and algorithms. However, the variety and sheer number of these resources make it challenging to find and use appropriate tools for each model, especially for novice modelers and experimentalists. To make these resources easier to use, we developed runBioSimulations (https://run.biosimulations.org), a single web application for executing a broad range of models. runBioSimulations leverages community resources, including BioSimulators, a new open registry of simulation tools. These resources currently enable runBioSimulations to execute nine frameworks and 44 algorithms, and they make runBioSimulations extensible to additional frameworks and algorithms. runBioSimulations also provides features for sharing simulations and interactively visualizing their results. We anticipate that runBioSimulations will foster reproducibility, stimulate collaboration, and ultimately facilitate the creation of more predictive models.

keywords.description: Keywords likely to be used in search queries

taxa.description: The biological entity represented by the model element
